title: Week 3 – Unit 2 (Under Pressure: Time Management + to/-ing)
targets: Vocabulary: 20–25 كلمة عن إدارة الوقت والضغط الدراسي
Grammar: أفعال تتبعها to + V وأفعال تتبعها V-ing (مع أزواج شائعة: stop/remember/try)
Listening: استماع موجّه حول تقليل المشتتات وتنظيم الوقت
Writing: خطة أسبوعية (6–8 جمل) تستخدم to/-ing بشكل صحيح

vocabulary.ex: We have a deadline on Monday.
Finish one task at a time.
Take a short break every 25 minutes.
Use a timer to work in blocks.
Keep a balance between study and rest.
Eat well to keep your energy.
Build a study habit every day.
Remove your phone from the desk.
Take deep breaths to feel calm.

grammar.title: أفعال + V-ing
grammar.when: نُعبّر عن أنشطة/تجارب مفضّلة أو مستمرة

grammar.title: أزواج شائعة (فرق المعنى)
grammar.form: stop + V-ing (إيقاف النشاط) / stop + to + V (إيقاف شيء آخر لعمل جديد) | remember/forget + to + V (قبل الفعل) vs + V-ing (ذكرى ماضية) | try + to + V (محاولة) vs + V-ing (تجربة طريقة)
signals: try to focus/try using a timer

grammarPractice.q: She stopped ___ (use) her phone during study.
remember + to + V تُستخدم عندما نتذكّر شيئًا قبل فعله.

reading.pre: توقّع: ما فائدة تقسيم الدراسة إلى فترات قصيرة مع استراحات؟
reading.text: Many students study for long hours but lose focus. A simple method is to work for about 25 minutes, then take a 5-minute break. During the work time, remove distractions and follow a small checklist. After four rounds, take a longer break. This routine helps students reduce pressure and make steady progress.

tasks.q: The text suggests removing distractions during work time.

choices: the method of blocks and breaks

tasks.q: The speaker recommends putting the phone away while studying.

writing.prompt: اكتب خطة أسبوعية (6–8 جمل): (1) متى تدرس يوميًا، (2) كيف تقلّل المشتّتات، (3) جملة فيها to + V، (4) جملة فيها V-ing.
tips: Use to + V for plans: I plan to study at 7 pm.
Use V-ing for activities: I enjoy reading summaries.
Keep sentences short. Check spelling and -s/-ing.

items.q: stop + to + V يعني التوقف عن النشاط نفسه.
He tried ___ (focus), but it was noisy.
Try ___ (use) a timer to be efficient.
I need ___ (finish) this task before the deadline.
She stopped ____ (check) messages and started studying.
